gaia::ui::ComboClickListener Class Reference

Developer need to inherit ComboClickListener and set to ComboPicker::setListener(gaia::ui::ComboClickListener*) When user selects a list item, it will call this listener and give which item user select. More...

Private Attributes

gaia::ComboClickListenerStub * mpComboClickListenerStub

Detailed Description

Developer need to inherit ComboClickListener and set to ComboPicker::setListener(gaia::ui::ComboClickListener*) When user selects a list item, it will call this listener and give which item user select. 

  class MyComboClickListener : public gaia::ui::ComboClickListener
  {
      public:
            Scene* mScene;
            gaia::core::Page* mPage;
            MyComboClickListener(Scene* pScene) { GLOGENTRY(); mScene = pScene; };
            MyComboClickListener(EmptyPageTest* pPage) { GLOGENTRY(); mPage = pPage; };
            ~MyComboClickListener() { GLOGENTRY(); };
            void onClick(int32_t position, long long id, const gaia::base::String& str){
                printf("Position=%d ID=%lld, str=[%s]", position, id, str.string());
            };
  };



 void EmptyPageTest::onInit(Persistence *savedInstanceState) {

     gaia::ui::LinearController* ll = new gaia::ui::LinearController(static_cast<Page*>(this));
     ll->setOrientation(gaia::ui::LinearController::VERTICAL);

     gaia::base::StringArray instringArray(6);
     instringArray.replaceAt("Cupcake",0);
     instringArray.replaceAt("Donut",1);
     instringArray.replaceAt("Eclair",2);
     instringArray.replaceAt("Froyo",3);
     instringArray.replaceAt("Gingerbread",4);
     instringArray.replaceAt("ICE Cream",5);

     gaia::ui::ComboPicker mpComboPicker = new gaia::ui::ComboPicker(this);
     gaia::ui::ComboClickListener * mListener = new MyComboClickListener(this);
     mpComboPicker->setListener(mListener);

     gaia::base::String* tmpstr = new gaia::base::String("Snake");
     mpComboPicker->setTitle(tmpstr);
     mpComboPicker->setItemList(instringArray);
     ll->addWidget(mpComboPicker);
     mScene->attachController(ll);
     mScene->setupSceneLayout();
 }
